text:
Flushing Meadow Park (Queens): East across the lower tip of the park and the Independent System Subway bridge over Grand Central Parkway. The park is under construction for the 1939-40 New York World's Fair.

View 2 is west across the same area toward Forest Hills, from near Vleigh Place and Union Turnpike; view 3 shows a corner at Grand Central Parkway and Union Turnpike.

View 1: April 23, 1936
View 2: March 3, 1937
View 3: May 30, 1939

P. L. Sperr
title: Queens: Grand Central Parkwa - Union Turnpike

title: Queens: Grand Central Parkwa - Union Turnpike

text:
Grand Central Parkway, north from Union Turnpike, showing the new boroughwide highway under construction across the Flushing meadows. View 3 shows the Parkway as it passes under the Union Turnpike bridge.

P. L. Sperr

April 23, 1936
Views 1,2,3:
title: Queens: Grand Central Parkwa - Union Turnpike

April 23, 1936

title: Queens: Grand Central Parkwa - Union Turnpike

text:
Grand Central Parkway, east from Union Turnpike. Grand Central Parkway can be seen running toward the background, toward where the Queens General Hospital is visible on the horizon. Union Turnpike runs across the face of the view from right to left. This whole area is under construction and marks the point of convergence of several borough-wide highways, with numerous underpasses and overpasses.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: April 23, 1936
View 2: June 29, 1936
View 3: February 10, 1937

title: Queens: Grand Central Parkwa - Union Turnpike

text:
Grand Central Parkway (center of view), north from Union Turnpike, showing the new highway winding its course through Flushing Meadow Park, the latter being under construction for the New York World's Fair, 1939-40. In the foreground is a subway train of the Independent System Subway, and on the left is 113th Place.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: March 3, 1937
Views 2, 3: July 7, 1940

Views 2, 3 show the Grand Central Parkway running north from Queens Boulevard, after completion.

view#2: Neg. No. A-879
view#3: Neg. No. A-876

title: Queens: Grand Central Parkwa - Union Turnpike

text:
Flushing Meadow Park (Queens): Two views of the expansive grounds of the New York World's Fair 1939-40, viewing north from Union Turnpike at Grand Central Parkway. The body of water is Willow Lake, in the amusement area; and across it is the main exposition center with the perisphere and Trylon--the Fair's theme--clearly visible; to its right is the parachute jump. On the left, running parallel to the park, is Grand Central Parkway.

May 30, 1939
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Queens: Union Turnpike - Grand Central Parkway
